alert.note: Alert for South Willamette Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 27 at 3:42PM PST until January 28 at 8:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Portland OR has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Oregon... Marys River near Philomath affecting Benton County. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Marys River near Philomath. * WHEN...From late Saturday night until Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Above 20.0 feet, expect widespread low land and agricultural flooding. Numerous roads along the Marys are affected, and some structures near the river may begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM PST Saturday the stage was 19.1 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 600 AM PST.
